message_1: What is the standard electrode potential of a silver electrode (Ag) when it is dipped in a solution of silver nitrate (AgNO3) at 298 K and 1 atm pressure? The reduction half-reaction for silver is: Ag+(aq) + e- -> Ag(s).
message_2:
The standard electrode potential (E°) for the reduction half-reaction of silver (Ag) is a constant value that can be found in standard reduction potential tables. For the given half-reaction:

Ag+(aq) + e- -> Ag(s)

The standard electrode potential (E°) is +0.7996 V at 298 K and 1 atm pressure.
